title: Knowledge Base as an Engine: Built for RAG, Not for Reading
hook: A classic SAP KB is dead text. A modern AMS knowledge base is an execution engine for humans, bots, and AI.
idea: If knowledge can’t be retrieved precisely under pressure, it doesn’t exist. AMS knowledge must be structured, opinionated, and machine-readable from day one.

what_fails_today: Long wiki pages without decision points
Search by keywords instead of symptoms
Knowledge written once and never validated
Docs that explain SAP, not how *your* system behaves

rag_first_principles: Small atomic chunks beat long explanations.

dimensions: Failure mode (data, auth, integration, logic, performance)
Object type (BP, material, order, IDoc, job)
sap_taxonomy.rule: Every knowledge atom must be tagged across at least 3 dimensions.

knowledge_lifecycle.create: Born from real incidents, changes, and RCAs — never hypothetical.
knowledge_lifecycle.validate: Used at least once in a real case or drill.
knowledge_lifecycle.measure: Track whether it reduced diagnosis or resolution time.
knowledge_lifecycle.retire: Delete or rewrite if it’s unused or misleading.

copilot_moves: Convert incident timelines into knowledge atoms automatically.
Suggest missing atoms for high-incident areas.
Answer chat questions using KB + live context (RAG).
human_role: Decide what is ‘blessed truth’ vs historical note.

why_this_changes_ams: Experts stop answering the same questions.
AI assistance becomes reliable instead of hallucinating.
design_question: Can the system answer the question faster than the senior consultant?
